label: Under the Table and Dreaming

label: Crash
grammy:
BEST ROCK PERFORMANCE BY A DUO OR GROUP WITH VOCAL
So Much To Say
fact: By the year 2000 Crash had sold seven million copies making it DMB's best selling album to date

label: Before These Crowded Streets
fact: The album debuted at number one of the Billboard charts, ending the Titanic soundtrack's sixteen week run as number one

label: Everyday
fact: The first DMB record that features Dave Matthews playing electric guitar.

label: Busted Stuff
grammy:
BEST MALE ROCK VOCAL PERFORMANCE
Gravedigger
fact: "Busted Stuff" is the first record performed entirely by the core members of the DMB, there are no featured performers.

label: Stand Up
fact: The last DMB record before saxophonist LeRoi Moore's death in 2008, though subsequent albums do feature recordings of Moore.

label: Big Whiskey & the GrooGrux King
fact: 44 musicians are featured on the album including 17 violinists

label: Away from the World
fact: The music video for "Mercy", the album's lead single, features photo and video contributions from 14,334 DMB fans

label: Come Tomorrow
fact: The album debuted at number one on the Billboard charts making DMB the first band to have seven consecutive number one albums
